intro: Tenorea corymbosa, commonly known as the sweet sarsaparilla, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its climbing habit and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pink flowers that are clustered in corymbs, giving it its scientific name. Its roots are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The plant thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
